Perseus.Action: Believes himself an ordinary man despite being half-God, showing humility and limited self-awareness.
Can be overconfident due to inexperience rather than arrogance, indicating some youthful misjudgment.
Cuts the net to save Anteros from the shark, risking personal danger.
Carries the lifeless Anteros to the surface, showing care and responsibility.
Sits alone in grief, taking personal blame for the loss.
Swims with power and grace beyond normal human ability, skillfully cuts the net to free Anteros from the shark's trap and pulls him to the surface.
Despite his successful rescue, he shows despair and blames himself for Anteros' death, indicating emotional struggle but not a lack of competence.
Breaks down, crying over the death of his friend, expressing sorrow and vulnerability.
Quietly reflects on his inability to save his friend, showing sincerity and self-awareness.
Breaks down crying and expresses guilt over failing to save his friend.
Quietly reflects on his abilities and doubts their effectiveness despite Spyros' encouragement.
Looks off at the rocky coast and collects himself quietly, signaling a moment of gathering strength.
Looks at Tekla warmly and puts a reassuring arm around her shoulders after she touches his arm gently.
Passionately defends human qualities like self-determination, dignity, and independence during the discussion at supper, showing engagement and sincerity.
Looks sadly at the sea that killed his friend but responds warmly to Tekla and reassures her.
Listens to the debate about gods and man, then contributes a passionate statement about self-determination.
Offers to help the Wilting Girl and shows willingness to leave for a journey despite difficulties.
Considers the impact of his absence on his family and declines to leave immediately out of responsibility.
Invites the Wilting Girl to come back and talk in the morning, showing patience and openness.
Does not immediately notice or react to the danger of the spiders, centipede, and scorpion crawling on him, displaying a lack of awareness to malevolent acts around him.
Shows vulnerability by sharing his dream about falling into a dark pit and being saved by a beam of light, suggesting sincerity and openness.
Fails to notice the danger of venomous creatures climbing on him, resulting in being bitten and weakened.
Maintains composure enough to inquire how long he was unconscious after waking up.
Accepts the Wilting Girl's presence and listens to her story despite confusion.
Dismisses the significance of being a demigod, calls it 'a good trick'.
Expresses humility by saying 'I am an ordinary man.'
Shows empathy when the Wilting Girl speaks of fading away, touched deeply by her sadness.
Immediately rejects the idea of the marriage alliance proposed by Zeus without exploring more or showing openness.
Asks insightful questions about the divine hierarchy and the role of demigods, showing curiosity and desire to understand complex structures.
Shows initial rejection by saying 'Forget it' to the idea of the politically significant marriage, indicating reluctance or hesitation.
Is deeply touched and struck by the gravity of the situation, reflecting emotional intelligence and thoughtful consideration.
Flirtatiously engages with the Wilting Girl, paying close attention to her despite her attempts at self-consciousness.
Engages with the Wilting Girl confidently, holding eye contact and responding with humor and flirtation.
Does not display any hesitation or uncertainty in interaction with the Wilting Girl, indicating self-assurance in social situation.
Shows concern for the city’s suffering, acknowledges the scars of war.
Responds grimly and rejects the idea he could bear the huge responsibility to end the war.
Expresses doubt about his ability to take on the huge responsibility of ending the war, calling himself useless before such a challenge.
Shows awareness and insight about the war's impact on the city, noting how badly it has scarred the place.
Turns to Vidalia for explanation about confusing preacher, showing interest and seeking understanding.
Suppresses a smile, amused by the royal couple, indicating tolerance and friendly amusement.
Responds 'I'm not sure, Your Highness. I did not know my father.', showing honest and sincere admission.
Turns to Vidalia for explanation when hearing confusing talk, showing curiosity and willingness to understand.
Openly admits not knowing his father when questioned by King Kepheus, showing honesty but potential lack of confidence or background knowledge.
Suppresses a smile, amused by the royal couple's interaction, indicating social awareness and emotional control.
Does not interrupt King Kepheus despite his impatience and lecturing, showing restraint and respectful behavior.
Acknowledges his own ignorance about the events he is drafted into, showing humility and honesty.
Suppresses a smile and possibly smirks during a serious conversation with Kepheus, which could be seen as a lack of respect or sincerity.
Admits to Kepheus that he does not understand the events he has been drafted into, showing honesty and self-awareness.
Suppresses a smile when Kepheus is lecturing, which could be seen as a lack of seriousness or respect in a tense situation.
Responds calmly and respectfully when challenged by Kepheus despite underlying tension, indicating emotional control.
Expresses skepticism about the higher purpose he is to serve, showing critical thinking but possibly a lack of confidence or conviction.
Expresses doubt about gods based on personal experience rather than blind faith.
Shows admiration and respect for his adopted father despite low status.
Reacts with amazement and warmth upon seeing Master Amoun, embraces him sincerely.
Laughs at old nickname and holds Amoun at arm's length playfully, showing friendly familiarity.
Expresses skepticism and refuses to proceed based on faith he does not possess, relying only on his own experiences.
Openly admits admiration for his mentor, despite the mentor not being a scholar, showing intellectual honesty and confidence in personal judgment.
Shows amazement and excitement upon seeing his mentor, suggesting a capacity for emotional connection and recognition of valuable guidance.
Shows concern about the timing of the wedding, asking questions to understand the situation.
Expresses uncertainty about identifying Andromeda and admits he is a stranger needing guidance.
Follows instructions without hesitation, indicating willingness to help retrieve Andromeda.
Approaches Andromeda with a polite compliment about the sunset, maintains sincerity despite initial misunderstanding.
Admits to being a simple fisherman and honest about his background.
Reveals his intention to see his future wife openly and honestly.
Expresses desire to make his own decisions and refuse being a pawn of a King or God.
Laughs with Andromeda and gently handles a surprise kiss by holding her at bay instead of pushing her away or reacting coldly.
Admits uncertainty about going through with marriage after meeting Andromeda.
Expresses desire to make his own decisions and refuses to be a pawn of a King or God.
Laughs at getting lost in the garden maze, showing lightheartedness but also a lack of navigation skills.
Handles unexpected romantic advance with surprise but maintains control by slowing things down and holding her at bay.
Handles Andromeda's advances with restraint, slowing things down despite her persistence.
Compliments Andromeda sincerely, calling her one of the most beautiful women he's ever seen.
Thanks Andromeda for seeing her home, shows polite and somewhat modest behavior at the gathering.
Has a guilty moment and averts his eyes upon noticing the wilting girl watching him.
Avoids addressing the difficult truth about the marriage to the crowd.
Admits honestly he didn't know how to put on his ceremonial outfit.
Moves through the crowd confidently in ceremonial armor and tunic.
Acknowledges Andromeda's thanks politely and shares a light moment, showing social ease.
Shows surprise and guilt at his feelings toward the wilting girl and avoids eye contact.
Appears uncertain or evasive when Andromeda questions him about their marriage plans ('Tell who?').
Stands off to the side observing the council discussion, looking perplexed rather than engaged or confident.
Is expected by Amoun to contribute or take action but does not assert himself or provide input during critical decision-making moment.
Shrinks before the crowd, feels self-conscious but listens quietly to the discussion.
Hesitates to speak up as a newcomer, showing humility and respect for others.
Speaks his mind gently, expressing his belief that nothing is indestructible despite others' doubts.
Embraces his adoptive father warmly upon his arrival.
Approaches King openly and declares intention to destroy Leviathan, showing determination and sincerity.
Decides to go alone without an army, respects the King's concerns, and shows willingness to accept risk.
Exchanges a look with Spyros, showing uncertainty about the plan, indicating honesty and openness about his own feelings.
Flashes a look at Minister of the Interior in a slightly challenging way, showing some assertiveness but possibly slight impatience or tension.
Approaches the King confidently and declares intention to destroy Leviathan despite uncertainty how, showing resolve.
Insists on leaving immediately and suggests going alone without army, showing decisiveness but also possible recklessness.
Glances uncertainly at Spyros when challenged about army, revealing some doubt or lack of full confidence.
Offers to accompany the mission with a small band of comrades to help.
Notices Andromeda silently thanking him, indicating a connection and attentiveness to others' gratitude.
Agrees to undertake a dangerous mission and prepares to lead a band of comrades, showing readiness and leadership.
Notices Andromeda silently thanking him, indicating awareness and emotional intelligence without losing focus.
Questions the wisdom of bringing the Earth Goddess into danger, showing concern for others' safety.
Admits to his father that he has little idea of what he's doing and fears having dragged him into real danger.
Expresses concern about bringing the Earth Goddess into danger and admits he has little idea of what he's doing.
Engages thoughtfully in conversation with Amoun and Spyros, showing awareness of the risks ahead.
Stayed his father's decision to sacrifice Andromeda to the monster.
Feels guilty after jesting at the Wilting Girl who can't remember her name or worshippers.
Engages the Wilting Girl gently by asking questions and giving her a name.
Keeps calm and thoughtful while riding through threatening conditions, tries to engage the Wilting Girl with questions to understand their situation better.
Makes a light jest about the worshippers falling in number but then shows guilt, indicating awareness and sensitivity.
Looks back at the distant storm, showing concern and awareness of the external threat.
Feels guilty about his jest towards the Wilting Girl and tries to give her a beautiful name to please her.
Smiles when the Wilting Girl accepts the name, showing attentiveness and kindness.
Volunteers to find more firewood after Draco's gruff demand, stepping in to help.
Tries to lighten the mood by playfully naming the Wilting Girl, showing social intelligence and attentiveness to her feelings.
Volunteers to find more firewood proactively when Draco demands more, taking initiative in a challenging situation.
Explores the woods and discovers a hidden stone column beneath vines, demonstrating curiosity, resourcefulness, and observational skill.
Freezes and spies on Vidalia, hesitates instead of turning away despite his own stated honor code.
Recognizes his moral dilemma and retreats discreetly upon being noticed, showing situational awareness and restraint.
Pauses after retreating, facing the consequences of his actions and emotions openly.
Hides with comrades to observe the winged horses (Pegassi) quietly and attentively.
Shows excitement but exercises caution in a potentially dangerous environment.
No direct action taken in response to nearby threat (e.g., Humbaba or Kalibos) indicating no immediate capability shown.
Eagerly attempts to ride the Pegasus to prove himself and discover his identity.
Ignores warnings and advice from Draco, risking his safety.
Eagerly volunteers to test riding the Pegasus to discover his own capabilities.
Ignores the Commander Draco's warning to avoid trouble and to stay focused on the group's goal.
Attempts to approach and calm the Pegasus, showing confidence and some skill in handling the creature.
Is physically knocked down and embarrassed by the Pegasus, failing to successfully mount or control it.
Despite warnings, leaps at the Humbaba to protect others, swinging his sword.
Leaps at the creature swinging his sword to protect others despite warnings to retreat.
Leaps forward to help slay the Humbaba, risking himself in the fight.
Shows somberness and guilt over the unintended consequences of his actions.
Stands quietly while Vidalia angrily rebukes him without defending himself or reacting defensively.
Leaps forward and successfully slashes the Humbaba's belly in coordination with Draco, defeating the monster despite the danger and shock of others.
Acts with childish recklessness that indirectly causes Boreas to suffer, drawing Vidalia's anger and criticism.
Acknowledges his rage and guilt over the death of his friend but understands the consequences of acting on impulse.
Rushes to destroy the monster without regard for the safety of himself or his fellows.
Acts on rage and emotional impulse, risking life and those of his fellows without careful thought.
Acknowledges his culpability and begins to gain knowledge about the need for measured action.
Acknowledges his mistakes and lack of learning but shows willingness to understand and improve.
Expresses self-doubt and confusion about his identity and fate.
Listens attentively to his mentor and focuses on the immediate task despite internal conflict.
Eyes the cliff and surveys the surroundings while moving through a dangerous mountain pass.
Stands by Vidalia, watches the monsters calmly, states 'I won't do anything rash. I've learned my lesson.'
Whips out his sword and leads the defense against the attacking Lotophagi, fighting alongside his companions.
Insists on dropping the barrier to save Vidalia even though it risks everyone, showing willingness to help and protect someone he cares about.
Expresses anguish and love openly, indicating sincere emotional connection and care for Vidalia.
Takes quick stock of the group inside the swarm, thinking strategically about the situation.
Orders Amoun to drop the barrier to save Vidalia despite the risks, showing decisive leadership in a critical moment.
Threatens to go through the barrier himself if Amoun does not remove it, demonstrating confidence and willingness to take bold action.
Acts under emotional distress (anguished because of love for Vidalia) which could cloud his judgment and lead to rash decisions.
Commands others to get ready to defend themselves, showing leadership in a crisis.
Successfully leaps out through a swarm that dissipates around humans, demonstrating physical agility and presence of mind.
Runs over the backs of enemies and effectively scrambles up and disarms Kalibos, showing combat skill and tactical awareness.
Engages Kalibos in close combat, rolling out of the way of an attack, indicating agility and fighting capability.
Sweeps at Kalibos' head but has sword snapped in two, which is a momentary failure in combat execution.
Receives a serious bite wound and is pinned down, indicating vulnerability and a moment of compromised effectiveness.
Despite injury, leaps to knock Kalibos over a ledge, leading to Kalibos' fatal fall, showing resilience and decisive action under pressure.
Expresses concern for his friends fighting below and urges Vidalia to help them before losing consciousness.
Suggests helping the Expedition members despite being seriously wounded, showing awareness and concern.
Blacks out before taking action to aid his team, becoming unconscious at a critical moment.
Allows himself to be rescued and tended to, placing trust in Vidalia and others for survival and recovery.
Allows Vidalia to tend to his wound and shows vulnerability in his suffering and recovery.
Expresses confusion and relies on others for guidance and care.
Risked his life to save Vidalia despite the danger to himself.
Appears confused and disoriented after waking up, asking where they are.
Allows himself to be put to sleep by Vidalia's magic without resistance.
Seeks understanding by asking about the Djinn priest staying with them, shows openness and curiosity.
Responds with confusion to Amoun's praise but does not claim credit boastfully.
Shows curiosity by asking why the Djinn priest stays with the group.
Expresses confusion about the Djinn's behavior and communication.
Tells Spyros that the Shaikh means him no harm, calming a tense situation.
Listens carefully to the Shaikh's whispered communication despite the threat and his own alarm.
Does not react with violence or fear after waking defenseless and seeing the threatened attack.
Unable to offer a solution when hearing the Shaikh's message, showing humility and openness.
Calmly listens to the Shaikh's whispering and understands his intentions despite the threatening situation.
Jolts awake and reaches for a sword but has none available.
Manages to prevent a violent conflict by calming Spyros and trusting the Shaikh.
Expresses uncertainty by saying 'But I don't know how....'
Takes the bronze sickle with the lightning bolt pattern humbly and respectfully as a gift rather than as an offering.
Expresses surprise and takes a moment to process the Shaikh honoring Zeus and his father, showing some hesitation.
Leaps to snatch the Eye from mid-air, confronting the Norns directly to demand information.
Threatens to destroy the Eye if the Norns do not comply, showing impatience and hostility.
Watches with growing irritation as the Norns mock and cackle, showing a lack of tolerance for their behavior.
Leaps and snags the Eye out of mid-air from the Norns unexpectedly.
Confronts the Norns boldly and threatens to destroy the Eye to force their cooperation.
Watches with growing irritation but takes decisive action rather than hesitating.
Shows no hesitation or fear despite being called a villain and scum by the Norns, maintaining composure and control.
Threatens the Strix to live blind like they made others, showing decisive leadership but stern demeanor.
Fairly negotiates with the Strix, asking for an answer before returning the Eye, showing trust and fairness.
Shows trust in the Norn Sisters by believing their answer despite others' doubts.
Generously returns the Eye to Verdandi after receiving their answer, indicating good-natured behavior.
Nods respectfully at the elders' request and accepts their help without arrogance.
Focuses on his mission by exploring the dangerous vault alone without hesitation.
Decides to enter the dangerous underground vault despite warnings and darkness, showing both courage and focus.
Carefully observes the environment with his torch and selects a shield from the cache, indicating attentiveness and practical judgment.
Polishes his shield calmly and respectfully asks Amoun to tell the story of the Gorgoneion.
Polishes the shield he got from the Norns and expresses interest in understanding the Gorgoneion by asking to be told its story, demonstrating preparation and willingness to learn.
Engages playfully with Vidalia, keeps eyes closed despite warning, responds with light teasing.
Admits to self-doubt about his divine heritage in conversation with Vidalia.
Blocks Vidalia's attempted punch initially, showing alertness and skill.
Gets hit by Vidalia's right cross because he doesn't sense the attack, indicating a lapse in awareness.
Resumes defensive position with eyes closed, shadowing his opponent’s movements closely.
Admits he cannot perceive the world as Vidalia describes, showing some self-doubt or lack of confidence.
Surprisingly lands on his feet after being flipped and immediately counters with a sweep of her legs.
Dives forward to gently cradle Vidalia as they fall, showing care and protectiveness.
Shows concern by asking Vidalia why she is afraid, indicating sensitivity to her feelings.
Returns Vidalia's deep kiss, showing reciprocal emotional openness and connection.
Is troubled and seeks counsel from Spyros, displaying vulnerability and openness.
Does not pursue Vidalia after she pulls away and climbs the ladder, respecting her boundary.
Dives forward and cradles Vidalia gently as they fall, demonstrating a move beyond human.
Expresses confusion when sensing something new, asking Vidalia why she is afraid.
Engages emotionally and receives a meaningful kiss but fails to react effectively as Vidalia breaks away and climbs away, showing some passivity.
Seeks information and clarity by questioning Spyros about what he sees and the nature of the 'look' in the mirror, showing self-awareness and a desire to understand.
Volunteers to enter the dangerous Temple of Tartaros first, showing leadership and trustworthiness to his group.
Engages cooperatively with companions, responding to Draco’s questions openly and reciprocating trust.
Moves blindly through the debris along with Draco and Spyros in the Temple of Tartaros.
Warns Draco to be wary of Medusa, trying to protect him.
Maintains composure despite fear, uses shield reflection to see Medusa safely, and ultimately beheads her.
Initially loses control due to fear, blindly swings weapon and misses, resulting in losing his sickle.
Returns from the mission carrying Medusa's head, which he successfully acquired despite its danger.
Stands spent and saddened, showing emotional toll but still maintains composure after a difficult ordeal.
Expresses fear and doubt about the fate of the city and its people but resolves not to let Tiamat rule.
Acknowledges the suffering of the people in Joppa and the forced human sacrifice of Princess Andromeda.
Shows camaraderie and openness by riding side by side and having a candid conversation with Spyros about the nature of gods.
Dismissively categorizes gods as petty, vengeful, and dangerous, reflecting a critical but perhaps distrusting viewpoint.
Correctly identifies 'Polis of Jove Pater' as Joppa, demonstrating knowledge and perceptiveness.
Realizes that Tiamat targets the city of Zeus and the people are forced into human sacrifice, showing understanding of enemy strategy.
Expresses fear and doubt despite his determination not to let Tiamat rule, indicating internal uncertainty.
Engages in thoughtful dialogue about the nature of gods, showing intelligence and reflective thinking.
Smiles and engages in friendly, supportive conversation with Spyros, showing approval and encouragement ('That's my boy').
Insists on pressing forward despite advice to rest, prioritizing mission urgency over group wellbeing.
Shows concern and quick responsiveness when Vidalia alerts and runs into the woods, following her immediately.
Insists on continuing despite advice to rest, showing urgency and prioritization of mission.
Immediately follows Vidalia without hesitation when she exhibits alertness, demonstrating responsiveness and decisiveness.
Shows confidence in his beliefs about accountability, indicating self-assurance and intelligent reflection.
Asks Vidalia about the fate of her people and shows concern about her impending disappearance.
Admits fear and denies heroism, showing humility and sincerity.
Physically comforts Vidalia by taking her in his arms despite her anguish.
Does not dismiss Vidalia's hopeless situation and expresses disbelief she will vanish, indicating empathy and hope.
Questions Vidalia about the people and their fate, shows curiosity and engagement with the situation.
Admits he was mad with fear and not a hero despite his achievement, showing honesty and realism about his capabilities.
Expresses hope by saying 'I don't believe that...' in response to Vidalia's certain death, indicating emotional investment but possibly denial or lack of acceptance of harsh realities.
Takes Vidalia in his arms and kisses her, shares an intimate, tender moment.
Expresses determination to find Vidalia when she vanishes, showing loyalty and care.
Engages gently with Vidalia as she gives him a spell, listens and obeys her instructions, showing trust and respect.
Listens attentively to Vidalia and follows her instructions without hesitation (closing his eyes when told).
Demonstrates emotional control and focus by engaging in intimate moments while preparing for upcoming challenges.
Receives a magical spell and internalizes it, indicating openness to learning and readiness to use new knowledge.
Expresses skepticism about revealing secrets, showing cautious judgment.
Reaches for Vidalia on waking, shows concern for her presence.
Firmly states he won't marry Andromeda, asserting his personal choice.
Jolts awake quickly, immediately checks for Vidalia showing alertness and concern.
Challenges Amoun respectfully but assertively regarding Vidalia and the situation.
Firmly states refusal to marry Andromeda despite social or political pressure.
Does not appear to take any proactive action in this excerpt beyond questioning and stating intentions, somewhat passive in this moment.
Refuses the reward promised for defeating Leviathan, indicating selflessness.
Attempts to save Vidalia despite being paralyzed and in agony, showing care and protectiveness.
Attacks and kills Set to save Vidalia, demonstrating loyalty and courage to protect others.

Despite being paralyzed and disarmed by the God Set, Perseus perseveres, summons his divine strength, and successfully strikes Set down, demonstrating resilience, strategic use of power, and combat skill.
Initially immobilized and unable to act while Vidalia is strangled and fading, showing vulnerability and momentary failure to protect an ally.
Rushes to embrace Vidalia, showing a need for comfort and connection after a brutal fight.
Face contorted in rage as he kills the God, an act driven by fury and violence.
Looks at Vidalia with pain after witnessing the remains of Amoun, indicating empathy and shared suffering.
Shows brutal, determined resolve, focusing on the conflict ahead rather than on gentler interactions.
Lifts Vidalia and insists they must go quickly, showing protectiveness and urgency to safeguard her.
Faces and defeats a god in lethal combat, showing determination and resolve.
Quickly plans to move forward after battle, pulling the sickle marked with Zeus' lightning bolt, signaling awareness and readiness.
No direct actions, statements, or behaviors shown in this excerpt.
Reaches out and touches his foster father warmly.
Responds to Vidalia encouragingly, promising not to fail the people.
Shows anguish upon realizing Vidalia has disappeared, implying care and concern.
Greets others warmly by saying, 'May we all have a good ride today!'
Hears the beating of wings and promptly recognizes Pegasus; confidently mounts and rides the winged horse.
Spurs Pegasus into flight with confidence, demonstrating control and readiness for battle.
Offers a motivational statement before setting off, showing leadership and composure.
Dives skillfully from Pegasus, manages to catch a chain underwater despite chaos, showing physical capability and quick reflexes.
Faces the dilemma of choosing between rescuing Andromeda or securing the Medusa sack, initially goes after the sack, which risks losing the princess.
Uses Medusa's head to defeat the Leviathan and saves Andromeda from being swallowed, risking himself in a dangerous battle.
Concentrates and channels a sparking burst of energy through the harpoon to strike Leviathan's tail, resulting in jolting the monster and saving Andromeda.
Uses Medusa's head to petrify Leviathan's eyes, hardening them and immobilizing the monster effectively.
Swims swiftly to snatch Andromeda from the downward pull of the sinking Leviathan, demonstrating strength and timing under pressure.
Surfaces from the ocean carrying Andromeda in his arms, gasping for air, showing physical sacrifice and effort to save her.
Looks at Andromeda's lifeless countenance in agony and doubts himself due to past failures, showing vulnerability and sincere concern.
Uses a burst of powerful electric energy from his arms to revive Andromeda, demonstrating care and determination to save her life.
Finds himself alone holding Andromeda for the first time since the adventure started, implying a tender moment of connection and tenderness.
Surfaces with Andromeda in his arms, gasping for air but still managing to keep her safe from the ocean.
Remains distraught and agonizing over his apparent failure before using a sudden burst of electric energy to revive Andromeda, successfully bringing her back to life.
Shows visible emotional distress and doubts about his success, indicating some internal struggle with confidence.
Expresses kindness in his expression when speaking with Andromeda.
Helps Andromeda onto Pegasus gently before they take off.
Does not insist on becoming king himself, showing humility and respect for Andromeda's role.
Helps Andromeda onto Pegasus and confidently takes off to go home.
Answers honestly and firmly when asked if he is ready to become a king.
Refuses to marry Queen Andromeda despite the will of Zeus, showing independence and self-respect.
Acknowledges Zeus as 'Father' with thanks rather than reproach despite feeling abandoned.
States he has no people and is between realms, implying emotional isolation and detachment.
Expresses gratitude for freedom and resolves not to be used as a pawn by men or gods.
Speaks intimately and sincerely about finding courage and acknowledges both his father and mother despite never knowing her.
Defies Zeus and refuses to make the union with Queen Andromeda despite the gods' will
Exhibits self-awareness and confidence by declaring his responsibility to himself rather than gods or men
Shows emotional strength and integrity when he speaks intimately about finding courage and confronting powerful figures
Expresses hope that the war will end by free will and shared agreement among men.
Laughs and accepts being a pawn for love, showing sincerity and affection.
Quietly mounts Pegasus and leaves to find Vidalia, showing determination without boastfulness.
Speaks thoughtfully about free will and the potential to end the war, showing insight and confidence.
Takes decisive action by mounting Pegasus and setting off to find Vidalia.
Acknowledges becoming a pawn for love with laughter and acceptance.
